q: a briefing President Lyndon Johnson gave in 1966 on the Vietnam War and White House papers from July 1975- when he was chief of staff under President Lyndon Johnson Gerald Ford - with passages initialed by Donald Rumsfeld 's then-assistant, Dick Cheney . It's not a journal, it's not a diary, he says of the Gerald Ford White House notes. "It is a set of working documents that I've never edited. In fact, most I've never reread." it is right to give someone a second chance." Asked about the suggestion that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to quit, Mr David Cameron insisted he would not comment on "private conversations". Of course he, as anyone who is human would be, is extremely embarrassed by the endless publicity and speculation about what happened many years ago when he was editor of the News of the World. But he praised Mr Andy Coulson 's performance in his current role, saying the Downing Street press office worked in a very "proper" way and he had not received a single complaint.

the past. Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. "You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world."
